Key Arguments: The proposed ACMA powers are seen as an attempt to censor free speech in Australia.
The penalties within the bill are harsh and hidden at the end of the document.
The definitions of misinformation and disinformation are subjective and can be misused by governments.
The bill excludes professional news content and government-sponsored content, which are seen as biased.
There is a concern that the powers could lead to a situation similar to authoritarian regimes.
Main Themes: Bias in media and government content
Notable Quotes: How dare unelected bureaucrats be licensed to censor free speech in a supposedly democratic country such as Australia?
The definitions of disinformation and misinformation can easily be interpreted subjectively, as has already happened.
If these new ACMA powers are implemented, Australia will be going down the path of the old East Germany, North Korea and Communist China to name but three.
